verbose_text: MAP3K2 encodes MAPK kinase kinase 2 (MEKK2), which is a component of a protein kinase signal transduction cascade that preferentially regulates the c-Jun N-terminal kinases (JNKs) and extracellular signal regulated kinase 5 (ERK5) pathways by phosphorylating and activating MAP2K5 as well as MAP2K7 in a similar manner.
evidence: extracellular signal-regulated kinase 5 (ERK5) pathways by phosphorylating and activating MAP2K5
